title: S&P Drops Controversial Part of Ratings Plan for Insurers
sub_head: Ratings firm got warning letter from Justice Department about antitrust issues
body:
S&P Global Ratings has withdrawn a controversial part of a proposed revamping of its model for determining creditworthiness of insurers following criticism that its move appeared to be self-serving and could hurt competition.
The firmâ€™s proposal had managed to anger insurance companies, state insurance regulators, rival ratings firms and even a bipartisan group of lawmakers on Capitol Hill, The Wall Street Journal detailed last month.
